translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 有常神通、無常神通、自識宿命神通、識他宿命神通、眼識神通、耳識神通，此六法義有何差別？」
translation: What are the differences in the meanings of the six dharmas: supernormal power of permanence, supernormal power of impermanence, supernormal power of the past lives of one's own consciousness, supernormal power of the past lives of consciousnesses of others, supernormal power of the eye consciousness, and supernormal power of the ear consciousness?"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告解釋菩薩：「如是，如是。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the Explanation Bodhisattva, "So it is, so it is.

source_sentence: 如汝所問，此六神通各各不異，今當與汝說。
translation: As you've asked, each of these six supernormal powers is different, and I will now explain them to you.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩得有常通，盡觀萬物生生不絕，前生是前生、後生是後生，若經一劫至百千劫，劫起則起、劫滅則滅，觀見此識亦不腐敗。
translation: When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains the power of permanence, he observes that all things are born and don't end, that previous births are previous births and subsequent births are subsequent births, and that if one eon or a hundred thousand eons pass, then an eon arises and an eon ceases, and he observes that this consciousness doesn't decay.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 無明根深不可得敗。
translation: The faculty of nescience is too deep to be defeated.

source_sentence: 「復次，無常通者，亦復觀見一切眾生有形之類，有生者滅者，從一劫乃至百千劫，劫起則起、劫滅則滅，知彼受形悉歸磨滅而不常存，是謂菩薩摩訶薩有常通、無常通各各差別。」
translation: "Furthermore, someone with the power of impermanence also observes that all sentient beings of a physical type are born and cease, from one eon up to a hundred thousand eons, and when an eon arises, it arises, and when an eon ceases, it ceases, knowing that their sensory forms all come to be ground into extinction and don't always remain, which is called the distinction between bodhisattvas' permanent and impermanent abilities."

source_sentence: 佛復告解釋菩薩曰：「於是，族姓子！
translation: The Buddha again told the Explanation Bodhisattva, "Thus, clansman!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩若獲自識通者，便能自見一身二身至百千身，從劫至劫其中經歷盡能自識，我生某國某縣，姓字如是種姓如是。
translation: If a bodhisattva Mahāsattva acquires the ability of self-consciousness, then he can see for himself one body, two bodies, up to a hundred thousand bodies, and from eon to eon, he can know for himself the full range of experiences therein, such as, 'I was born in a certain country or county, and my family name is thus and so, and my lineage is thus.

source_sentence: 復自識知初受四大受形若干，悉能分別善惡之行，是謂自識通也。」
translation: He also knows by his own consciousness how many of the four major sensations he first received and how many good and bad deeds he can discern, which is called the penetration of self-consciousness."

source_sentence: 佛復告族姓子：「菩薩摩訶薩得他人神通智者，從此欲色界乃至有想無想天，盡能分別一一所趣，從一歲至百千萬歲，從一劫至百千萬劫，其中成敗所經歷處，盡能分別悉皆識知，是謂菩薩摩訶薩知他人神通。」
translation: Again, the Buddha told the clansman, "When a bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains the knowledge of the psychic abilities of others, he can discern and know every single destiny from the desire realm up to the heavens of perception and non-perception, from one year to a hundred million years, and from one eon to a hundred million eons, as well as all the places of formation and demise that they experience, which is called the bodhisattva's knowledge of the psychic abilities of others."

source_sentence: 佛復告族姓子：「菩薩摩訶薩得眼識通，觀三千大千世界，知受形者、不受形者，悉能見有形。
translation: The Buddha again told the clansman, "The bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains the visionary ability to contemplate 3,000 great one-thousand worlds and knows that those who are shaped and those who aren't shaped can all see things that are shaped.

source_sentence: 從一歲至百千萬歲，從一劫至百千萬劫，皆悉觀見而不錯亂，是謂菩薩摩訶薩具眼神通而無所著。」
translation: From one year to a hundred million years and from one eon to a hundred million eons, they all observe and see without confusion, which is called the bodhisattva Mahāsattva possessing the eye's ability without any attachment."

source_sentence: 佛復告族姓子：「菩薩摩訶薩得耳識通，悉聞十方眾生有苦樂聲者、無苦樂聲者、聞受善惡報聲者、不受善惡報聲者，皆悉聞知而不錯亂，是謂菩薩摩訶薩具耳識通而無所著。
translation: The Buddha again told the clansman, "When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains the ear-consciousness faculty, he can hear and understand without confusion the sounds of suffering and happiness, the absence of suffering and happiness, and the reception of the results of good and evil, as well as the absence of the results of good and evil, of sentient beings in the ten directions, which is called the bodhisattva being endowed with the ear-consciousness faculty and having nothing to attach to.

source_sentence: 是謂六法各各差別。」
translation: This is called the distinction between each of the six qualities."

source_sentence: 爾時，解釋菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the explanatory bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 有常通菩薩得此通者，盡知有形質者生生不絕，無常通者生生而滅。
translation: When a bodhisattva with the power of permanence attains this power, he knows at length that those with form and substance are born and don't cease, and those without the power of permanence are born and cease.

source_sentence: 如今觀見前生非後生，云何稱言生生不絕？
translation: Now, how can it be called being born and not ceasing when one observes that previous births are not subsequent births?

source_sentence: 復次，如來以得自識通盡識宿命，一身二身至百千身，一劫二劫至百千萬劫，今身非後身，此身異於前身。
translation: "Furthermore, since the Tathāgata attained self-consciousness and fully consummated consciousness in a prior life, from one body and two bodies to a hundred thousand bodies, and from one eon and two eons to a hundred million eons, the present body is not the subsequent body, and this body is different from the prior one.

source_sentence: 今識非後識，此識異於後識。
translation: The present consciousness is not the subsequent consciousness, and this consciousness is different from the subsequent consciousness.

source_sentence: 識離此識則同於眾生，云何世尊言稱自識宿命通？
translation: If consciousness is free of this consciousness, then they're the same as sentient beings, so why does the Bhagavān say that his consciousness has the ability to perform past lives?

source_sentence: 又，世尊言菩薩摩訶薩得知他人心通者，盡知一切眾生心識所，知自識心通亦知己心他心，知他人心通亦知己心他心，此二神通有何差別？
translation: Furthermore, the Bhagavān said that the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who knows the minds of others has full knowledge of the mental consciousnesses of all sentient beings, knows the mental power of his own consciousness and knows his own mind and the minds of others, and knows the mental power of the minds of others and knows his own mind and the minds of others, what is the difference between these two supernormal powers?

source_sentence: 如世尊言，菩薩摩訶薩得眼通者，觀見十方，從欲界上至有想無想天，皆悉觀見有受形不受形者、有受善惡報不受善惡報者。
translation: As the Bhagavān said, when a bodhisattva attains the power of the eye, he observes the ten directions, from the desire realm up to the heavens of perception and non-perception, and he observes them all as those who are feeling form and don't feel form, and those who are feeling the effects of good and evil and don't experience the effects of good and evil.

source_sentence: 復言得耳通菩薩，悉聞十方有苦樂聲無苦樂聲者、聞受善惡報不受善惡報者。
translation: It also says that a bodhisattva with auditory perception can hear everything in the ten directions that has the sound of suffering and happiness and that doesn't have the sound of suffering and happiness, and hears those who are subject to good and bad retribution and don't receive the retribution of good and bad.

source_sentence: 眼通亦見、耳識亦聞，此二有何差別？
translation: What's the difference between the seeing faculty that also sees and the ear consciousness that also hears?

source_sentence: 唯願，世尊！
translation: Venerable, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 重演分別，使我等永無狐疑。」
translation: Repeating the discernment will allow us to never have misgivings."

source_sentence: 佛告解釋菩薩曰：「菩薩摩訶薩得有常通，覺了諸法知住法性不變。
translation: The Buddha told the Explanation Bodhisattva, "The bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains the supernormal power of permanence, which is the ability to perceive all things and know that their abiding Dharma nature remains unchanged.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩得無常通，覺了諸法皆有變易，是謂無常通。
translation: The bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains the supernormal power of impermanence, which is the perception that all things are subject to change.

source_sentence: 「復次，諸法體性自爾，有佛無佛亦無生滅，是謂有常通。
translation: "Furthermore, since the essence of all things is self-evident, whether there's a buddha or no buddha, there's no arising or ceasing, which is called the penetration of existence and permanence.

source_sentence: 復次，諸法無常通者，悉歸磨滅亦不久存，生生不住，是謂無常通。
translation: Furthermore, when things are impermanent, they all come to pass and cease, don't last long, and are produced and don't abide, which is called the penetration of impermanence.

source_sentence: 「復次，菩薩摩訶薩得有常通，便為具足如來諸法，四意止、四意斷、四神足、五根、五力、七覺意、八賢聖道，是謂有常通。
translation: "Furthermore, when a bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains the power of permanence, he then fully possesses the Tathāgatas' four mental stabilizers, four mental stoppers, four miraculous abilities, five faculties, five powers, seven awakened thoughts, and eight noble paths, which is called the power of permanence.

source_sentence: 復次，諸法當來過去現在，善法惡法悉無所有，是謂無常通。
translation: Furthermore, the future, past, and present are all devoid of good qualities and bad qualities, which is called the power of impermanence.

source_sentence: 「復次，菩薩摩訶薩復觀眾生發三乘道應得羅漢，求師覺悟果如所願必然不疑；復見眾生發緣覺心，獨處曠野如其所果必然不疑；復見眾生發菩薩心，如其所願必然不疑。
translation: "Furthermore, once again, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva sees sentient beings who have arisen to become arhats on the path of the three vehicles and who seek teachers, realize the fruit of awakening as they wish, and certainly don't doubt it; once again, he sees sentient beings who have arisen the mind of pratyekabuddha and who are alone in the wilderness, and certainly don't doubt the fruit of their wishes; and once again, he sees sentient beings who have arisen the mind of bodhisattva, and certainly don't doubt it as their wishes.

source_sentence: 是謂菩薩摩訶薩有常神通。
translation: This is called the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's eternal superknowledge.

source_sentence: 若有善男子、女人，初求羅漢辟支佛道及行菩薩道，於中退轉在凡夫地不成就者，是謂無常神通。
translation: If there are good men and women who first pursue the path of the arhats, the solitary buddhas, and the path of the practicing bodhisattvas but then turn around in the middle and don't achieve it in the worldling stage, this is called impermanent supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 「復次，若有菩薩摩訶薩已得自識宿命通，自知無數宿命，初發道意建立功德，承事供養諸佛世尊定獲道果，復自憶識未受四大倚空不著色，是乃名曰自識宿命。
translation: "Furthermore, if a bodhisattva Mahāsattva has attained the power of knowing the past lives of his own consciousness, knows that his past lives are countless, establishes merit when he first arouses the intention to pursue the path, makes offerings to the buddhas and world-honored ones, and is certain to attain the fruit of the path, and then recalls that his consciousness has yet to be endowed with the four elements, relies on emptiness, and doesn't cling to form, this is called the past life of his own consciousness.

source_sentence: 或有菩薩得知他人心通，彼彼受身彼彼受形，然不能知本所從來，是謂世俗他心智。
translation: Perhaps a bodhisattva learns that other people's minds are penetrating, that they've received one body or another form, but they can't know where they came from, which is called conventional knowledge of other minds.

source_sentence: 復有善男子、女人，既得神通知他人心智，盡能具足內外神通，是謂自識神通、知他人心智各各有別。
translation: Again, if there are good men and women who have attained the ability to divinely notify the minds of others and can fully possess both internal and external supernormal abilities, this is called the distinction between self-cognizing supernormal abilities and knowing the minds of others.

source_sentence: 「若有善男子、女人，已獲眼通內外清淨，盡見三世眾生根原。
translation: "Suppose there's a good man or woman who has attained internal and external purity of the vision, and they can see the origin of sentient beings in all three worlds.

source_sentence: 或有菩薩以天眼見一千剎土，或有菩薩見二千剎土，或有菩薩見三千大千剎土，或有菩薩以天眼見一佛國，見二國土見三國土，於中悉知有退轉者不退轉者，是謂菩薩摩訶薩得天眼通，悉知諸界而無所有。」
translation: Perhaps a bodhisattva sees a thousand buddha lands with the divine eye, or a bodhisattva sees two thousand buddha lands, or a bodhisattva sees three thousand buddha lands, or a bodhisattva sees one buddha land, two land, and three land with the divine eye, and he or she knows the receding and the nonreceding among them, this is called a bodhisattva who has attained the divine vision and fully knows the elements and nothing in them."

source_sentence: 佛復告族姓子：「若有菩薩摩訶薩已得耳通，盡聞十方諸剎音響，有善音、無善音、有好音、無好音。
translation: The Buddha again told Clansman, "Suppose a bodhisattva Mahāsattva has attained the ability of hearing, and he can hear the sounds of the buddhas in the ten directions, whether they have good sounds, no good sounds, good sounds, or no good sounds.

source_sentence: 復有善男子、女人，聞一千二千三千剎土，或有菩薩聞一佛國土、二佛國土、三佛國土，乃至無數佛國音響。」
translation: Furthermore, if there are good men and women who hear the sounds of 1,200,000 buddha-lands, or if there are bodhisattvas who hear the sounds of one Buddha-land, two Buddha-lands, three Buddha-lands, or countless Buddha-lands, then the bodhisattva Mahāsattva explained to the clansman, "Suppose a bodhisattva has attained the ear faculty to hear all the sounds of the buddhas in the ten directions, whether there's good sound, no good sound, good sound, or no good sound."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告解釋菩薩曰：「於六事法便得具足，各有差別。」
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the Explanation Bodhisattva, "These six things can then be fulfilled, each with its own distinctions."

source_sentence: 爾時，解釋菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the Explanation Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來大慈說無量辯，一一分別眾生牢固，說六神通不可思議，非是羅漢辟支佛所能及知。
translation: The Tathāgata's great compassion explains immeasurable eloquence, which firmly establishes each individual sentient being, and explains that the six supernormal powers are unfathomable and beyond the ability of arhats and pratyekbuddhas to know.

source_sentence: 如世尊言：『演說六通無著法行猶懷狐疑。』
translation: As the Bhagavān said, 'He explains the six powers without attachment to the practice of the Dharma and still harbors doubts.'

source_sentence: 如世尊言：『有常神通說泥洹法，無常神通說有為法。』
translation: As the Bhagavān said, 'The eternal superknowledge teaches the state of nirvāṇa, and the impermanent superknowledge teaches the state of becoming.'

source_sentence: 若使善男子、女人得有為神通，便為身意即滅度乎？」
translation: If a good man or woman attains the miraculous powers that are existent, does that make their body and mind cease to exist?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「不然。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Otherwise."

source_sentence: 解釋菩薩言：「一切諸法無生無滅，今日如來身識即滅度乎？
translation: The Explanation Bodhisattva said, "All things are unarisen and unceasing, so today does the Tathāgata's bodily consciousness cease and pass away?

source_sentence: 何以復有言教耶？」
translation: Why is there again a teaching in words?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「非不說有常泥洹，亦不說無常神通。
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "It's not that we don't talk about eternal nirvāṇa, and we don't talk about impermanent superknowledge.

source_sentence: 但我神通知有知無，故說之耳。」
translation: I simply explain it because my supernormal powers inform us about existence and nonexistence."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊復告族姓子：「若有善男子、女人得有常神通者，便名為如來、至真、等正覺。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān again addressed the clansman, "If a good man or woman attains the miraculous power of permanence, then he or she will be called a tathāgata, a supreme truth, or a perfect awakening.

source_sentence: 得無常神通者，此人或在聖地，或在凡夫地，是謂二事各有差別。」
translation: When someone attains impermanent supernormal powers, they're either in the noble stage or in the stage of worldlings, which is to say that there's a difference between the two things."

source_sentence: 爾時，解釋菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the Explanation Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來、至真、等正覺已得眼識神通，盡能了見過去當來現在三世眾生，乃名曰神通。
translation: The Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, and the Completely Awakened One have attained the supernormal power of the visual consciousness, and they can see all three past, future, and present sentient beings, which is called supernormal power.

source_sentence: 復言耳聽過去當來現在無數世聲。
translation: It's also called the ear that hears past, future, and present sounds of countless lifetimes.

source_sentence: 若言眼見過去色耶？
translation: What if you say the eye sees past form?

source_sentence: 過去已滅。
translation: "The past has ceased.

source_sentence: 未來色耶？
translation: What about future form?

source_sentence: 未有形兆。
translation: There are no physical signs yet.

source_sentence: 眼識現在法界則我不疑。
translation: I don't doubt that the visual consciousness is present in the Dharma realm.

source_sentence: 唯願，世尊！
translation: May it be, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 使無聞眾生永得開悟。」
translation: It causes unheard sentient beings to attain permanent enlightenment."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告解釋菩薩曰：「諦聽諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the Explanation Bodhisattva, "Listen closely! Listen closely!

source_sentence: 善思念之！
translation: Think of it well!

source_sentence: 吾當為汝分別其義。
translation: I will discern their meaning for you.

source_sentence: 云何？
translation: How is that?

source_sentence: 族姓子！
translation: sons of a great clan!

source_sentence: 如有眾生已得天眼，遍觀一切有形色相，盡能分別亦無疑惑。
translation: "Suppose there's a sentient being who has attained the divine eye and fully observes all forms and shapes that exist, discerning them completely and without doubt.

source_sentence: 憶過去色忽然在前，盡皆了之無有障礙。
translation: They suddenly see past forms in front of them, and they fully comprehend them without obstruction.

source_sentence: 耳識神通亦復如是，念亦在前耳無所障悉皆了之。」
translation: Similarly, the ear consciousness' superknowledge and mindfulness of what's in front of him are fully comprehended without any obstruction."

source_sentence: 解釋菩薩復白佛言：「如今所聞倍生狐疑。
translation: The Explanation Bodhisattva then said to the Buddha, "What I've heard now has caused doubts.

source_sentence: 云何眼通耳通，見過去事聞過去聲？
translation: How do the eyes and ears understand and see past events and hear past sounds?'

source_sentence: 如我現在自識宿命，便能自知宿命事，如我耳識，現在知現在事？
translation: If I now know my past lives on my own, then I can know the events of my past lives on my own, just as I know presently the events of the present with my ear consciousness?

source_sentence: 云何得知過去未來？」
translation: How can we know the past and future?"

source_sentence: 佛告解釋菩薩曰：「或有眼通眼定識，或有眼通非眼定識；或有耳通耳定識，或有耳通非耳定識。
translation: The Buddha told the explaining bodhisattva, "Sometimes there's an eye that's permeated by the consciousness of eye concentration, and sometimes there's an eye that's permeated by the consciousness of non-eye concentration, and sometimes there's an ear that's permeated by the consciousness of ear concentration, and sometimes there's an ear that's permeated by the consciousness of non-ear concentration.

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩得眼識定通、耳識定通、便能見此從初受形至今後身，若大若小，其間分別不失定意通。
translation: If the bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains the consciousness of eye concentration and the consciousness of ear concentration, he'll be able to see this body from the first impressionable form to the body afterward, whether large or small, and discriminate between them without losing the ability to concentrate the mind.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩亦復如是，入此定意者觀一佛境界，復壞此界觀無數剎土，於中變現成就五陰、不成就五陰。
translation: Similarly, when a bodhisattva Mahāsattva enters this concentration, he observes the realm of a single Buddha and then destroys that realm to observe countless buddha-lands, in which he manifests the accomplished five aggregates and the unaccomplished five aggregates.

source_sentence: 或現小五陰，或現地五陰，或現水五陰，或現四天下五陰，或現寶山五陰，或現須彌山五陰，或現鐵圍山五陰，或現大鐵圍山五陰，或現人世城郭村聚五陰，或現遊戲浴池所居處五陰，或現諸天所居宮殿五陰，或現龍宮五陰，或現八部鬼神五陰，或現欲界眾生形，或現色界作色界眾生形，或現無色界作無色形，或現小世界作小世界形，或現千世界二千世界乃至三千大千世界。
translation: They may manifest the five aggregates of the lesser five aggregates, the five aggregates of the earth, the five aggregates of water, the five aggregates of the four continents, the five aggregates of Mount Sumeru, the five aggregates of Mount Tie Wai, the five aggregates of Mount Tai Tie Wai, the five aggregates of human cities, villages, towns, or mansions, the five aggregates of playgrounds and baths, the five aggregates of palaces and halls where gods live, the five aggregates of dragon palaces, the five aggregates of the eight kinds of ghosts, the form of sentient beings in the desire realm, the form of sentient beings in the form realm, the form of sentient beings in the formless realm, the form of the small world, the form of the small world, or the thousand worlds, two thousand worlds, or even the 3,000 great thousand worlds.

source_sentence: 或現眾生受果報不受果報，一時一日一月一歲，成劫敗劫清濁好醜善趣惡趣，諸佛出世菩薩翼從，盡能分別，是謂定眼識通、定耳識通。
translation: Whether it's a manifestation of sentient beings experiencing retribution or not, an hour, a day, a month, a year, an eon, a formation or defeat eon, a good or ugly destiny, or a bad destiny, the buddhas who appear in the world and the bodhisattvas who follow them can discern them all, which is called the penetration of the concentrating eye consciousness and the penetration of the concentrating ear consciousness.

source_sentence: 得諸如來神識感動到十方佛國，承事供養諸佛世尊。
translation: They're moved by the tathāgatas' spiritual consciousnesses to travel to Buddha lands in the ten directions to serve and make offerings to the buddhas and world-honored ones.

source_sentence: 復見諸菩薩興致供養衣被、飯食、床褥、臥具、病瘦、醫藥。
translation: They also see bodhisattvas making offerings of clothing, food, bedding, bedding, infirmity, and medicine.

source_sentence: 復見佛國清淨者、不清淨者，復見眾生修梵行者、不修梵行者，見五趣眾生受行不同所修各異。
translation: They also see buddha lands that are pure and those that are impure, and they see sentient beings who cultivate the religious practice and those who don't, and they see that sentient beings in the five destinies have different ways of feeling and doing things and cultivate different things.

source_sentence: 是謂菩薩摩訶薩得定眼識通、得定耳識通，盡觀過去當來今現在事而無所失。
translation: This is called the bodhisattva Mahāsattva attaining the penetration of the concentrated eye consciousness and the penetration of the concentrated ear consciousness, and he observes all past, future, and present events without losing anything.

source_sentence: 「復次，菩薩摩訶薩得眼識通，權現無數眾生境界不可思議，便能變化種種珍寶。
translation: "Furthermore, when the bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains the penetration of the visual consciousness, he has the unfathomable ability to visualize the unfathomable objects of countless sentient beings, and he can then change various kinds of treasures.

source_sentence: 諸有眾生往取珍寶者，悉施與之皆令充足。
translation: Whatever sentient beings go to take those treasures, they all give them to him, making them abundant.

source_sentence: 或復示現諸佛國土本行清淨，皆已畢故更不造新。
translation: They might also show that the buddha lands are originally pure, and once they've been completed, they don't create new ones.

source_sentence: 是謂菩薩摩訶薩得定識眼通、得定識耳通，盡能具足一切眾行。」
translation: This is called the bodhisattva Mahāsattva attaining the eye penetration of the concentrating consciousness and the ear penetration of the concentrating consciousness, which are fully capable of accomplishing all the various practices."

source_sentence: 爾時，解釋菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the Explanation Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 得定眼識通、得定耳識通，是等善男子、善女人為在何地？
translation: Where are these good sons and good women who have attained the penetration of the eye consciousness of concentration and the penetration of the ear consciousness of concentration?

source_sentence: 為供養諸佛幾時？」
translation: How long should I make offerings to the buddhas?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「是善男子、善女人，奉持修習定眼識通、定耳識通，已供養過去恒沙諸佛，已得總持不退轉行，諸根已具相好成就，父母端正種姓成就。
translation: The Buddha said, "Good sons and good women who consecrate and cultivate the penetration of the eye consciousness and the penetration of the ear consciousness have made offerings to the buddhas of the past sands, have attained the practice of nonretrogression with a general maintenance, have perfected their faculties, and have perfected the lineage of correct parents.

source_sentence: 復有菩薩雖得供養諸佛世尊，從一佛國至一佛國，承事禮敬諸佛世尊，然未得眼識通、耳識通。
translation: Another bodhisattva may have made offerings to the buddha-honored ones, gone from buddha land to buddha land, served and venerated the buddha-honored ones, but he hasn't yet attained the penetration of the visual consciousness and the penetration of the auditory consciousness.

source_sentence: 或有菩薩摩訶薩，雖得眼通未能具足眾行之本，以神足力遊至十方無量世界，承事供養諸佛世尊。
translation: Sometimes a bodhisattva Mahāsattva travels to measureless worlds in the ten directions with miraculous powers to serve and venerate the buddha world-honored ones even though he's attained the power of the eye and isn't able to fully grasp the basis of all his activities.

source_sentence: 或有菩薩摩訶薩，雖得眼通、耳通，未得定識者，不能悉知眾生所念，不能淨佛國土教化眾生。
translation: Sometimes a bodhisattva Mahāsattva who has attained the power of the eye and ear but hasn't yet attained the concentration consciousness isn't able to fully understand what sentient beings are thinking, and he can't purify the Buddha's land and teach sentient beings.

source_sentence: 或有菩薩摩訶薩，六通清徹內外無礙，不能具足四法門行。
translation: Perhaps there's a bodhisattva Mahāsattva whose six powers are clear and penetrating without obstruction inside or out, but who isn't able to fully practice the four dharma aspects.

source_sentence: 或有菩薩在一佛剎，周旋教化無所染著，未能備悉眾生根原。
translation: Sometimes a bodhisattva goes around a buddha's bha and teaches without defilement, but he's unable to fully comprehend the roots of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 或有菩薩自淨其剎，無婬怒癡眾生生其國土，雖生其國不盡苦本。
translation: Sometimes a bodhisattva purifies his own buddha and no lustful, angry, or deluded sentient beings are born in his land, even though their birth in that land doesn't end the root of suffering.

source_sentence: 或有菩薩發弘誓心：『若我後生已剎土生者，使我國人無三乘之名。』
translation: Some bodhisattvas make a great vow, 'If I'm born in a later life and am born in a later buddha land, it will be so that the people of my country won't have the name of the three-vehicle teaching.'

source_sentence: 此菩薩等不得定眼識通、定耳識通。
translation: These bodhisattvas won't be able to perceive the eye consciousness and the ear consciousness.

source_sentence: 復有菩薩發弘誓心：『我本誓願求無上正真道，使我國人盡同一行，國土清淨同一形像。』
translation: Another bodhisattva makes a great vow, 'I originally vowed to pursue the unsurpassed true path, so that the people of my country would all practice the same thing and my land would be purified and made to have the same appearance.'

source_sentence: 如彼所願已得不疑，如此等菩薩猶未得定眼識通、定耳識通。
translation: After vowing as they did, they attained the state of no doubt, but such a bodhisattva still hasn't attained the penetration of the concentrating eye consciousness or the penetration of the concentrating ear consciousness.

source_sentence: 復有菩薩發大弘誓心：『如我後成佛時，諸有眾生在我國者，一日成道盡取滅度。』
translation: Another bodhisattva makes a great vow, 'When I later become a buddha, all the sentient beings in my country will be completely liberated in a single day of attaining enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 如此等菩薩摩訶薩，猶未得定眼識通、定耳識通。
translation: Such a bodhisattva-mahāsattva still hasn't attained the penetration of the concentrating eye consciousness and the penetration of the concentrating ear consciousness.

source_sentence: 復有菩薩發弘誓心：『若我後作佛時，使我國土一切眾生同日成佛。』
translation: Another bodhisattva makes a great vow, 'When I become a buddha in the future, I will cause all the sentient beings in my land to become buddhas on the same day.'

source_sentence: 如此等菩薩便得定眼識通、定耳識通。」
translation: Such a bodhisattva then attains the penetration of the consciousness of concentrating the eye and the consciousness of concentrating the ear."

source_sentence: 爾時，解釋菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the explaining bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 頗有菩薩摩訶薩發弘誓心：『若我成佛時，一切眾生皆得一時成佛不乎？』」
translation: Could it be that a bodhisattva-mahāsattva makes a great vow, 'When I become a buddha, will all sentient beings become buddhas at the same time?'"

source_sentence: 佛言：「有！
translation: The Buddha said, "Yes!

source_sentence: 過去無數阿僧祇劫有佛，名號住無住如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，號佛、世尊。
translation: There were buddhas in the incalculably long eon of the past who were called abiding, unabiding tathāgatas, supreme truths, perfect enlightenment, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, well gone, worldly understanding, unsurpassed men, guides of the way, teachers of gods and humans, and were called buddhas and world-honored ones.

source_sentence: 國土名法妙，人壽三萬歲。
translation: Their land is called Dharmamitra, and their life span is 30,000 years.

source_sentence: 爾時，住無住如來壽十萬歲，發弘誓心使己國土眾生同日同時盡成佛道，即於彼日盡取滅度。」
translation: At the time, the abiding, nonabiding Tathāgata had a life span of 100,000 years, and he made a great vow to cause all the sentient beings in his land to attain the Buddhahood on the same day and at the same time, which would be the day he attains complete extinction."

source_sentence: 爾時，解釋菩薩復白佛言：「頗有如來、至真、等正覺發弘誓心：『若我後作佛時，使我十方世界虛空神識盡得佛道不耶？』」
translation: It was then that the Explanation Bodhisattva again said to the Buddha, "Could it be that the Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, and the Completely Enlightened One made a great vow, 'Suppose I become a buddha later on, will I completely attain the buddha path in the space of the worlds and the consciousnesses of the ten directions?'"

source_sentence: 佛言：「不也。
translation: The Buddha said, "No.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 眾生境界不可思議，虛空邊際無有涯底，過去滅盡不可稱量，將來生者亦無有限。」
translation: The sphere of sentient beings is unfathomable, the limit of space has no limit, the extinction of the past is incalculable, and there's no limit to those who will be born in the future."

source_sentence: 佛復告族姓子：「此賢劫前過去無數阿僧祇劫，過此數已復過無數阿僧祇劫，有佛名平等如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，號佛、世尊，出現於世。
translation: Again, the Buddha told the clansman, "Countless incalculably long eons have passed since before this good eon, and countless incalculably long eons have passed since then, when a Buddha named the Tathāgata-Equality, the Supreme Truth, the Completely Awakened One, Accomplished in Knowledge and Conduct, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Ruler of the Way, and Teacher of Gods and People appeared in the world.

source_sentence: 人壽千歲，國土清淨。
translation: Their human life span is a thousand years, and their land is pure.

source_sentence: 一日之中，現十方無數盡虛空界有形之類，盡同一日皆成無上正真之道，即於一日盡取般泥洹。」
translation: In a single day, they show an incalculably endowed category of beings in the space realm in ten directions, and on the same day they all become unsurpassed in the true path, which is to say that they completely attain parinirvāṇa in a single day."

source_sentence: 爾時，解釋菩薩復白佛言：「平等如來、至真、等正覺既成佛已，復使一切眾生十方無量世界虛空無邊際眾生，盡同一日皆成佛道。
translation: It was then that the Explanation Bodhisattva again said to the Buddha, "After the Tathāgata, Supreme Truth, and Completely Awakened One has become a buddha, he also causes all sentient beings in measureless space and limitless sentient beings in ten directions to attain the Buddha Way in a single day.

source_sentence: 云何今日復有如來及我等耶？
translation: How could there be another Tathāgata and us today?

source_sentence: 一切眾生乎？
translation: What about all sentient beings?

source_sentence: 云何復有天道、人道、畜生、餓鬼、地獄道乎？」
translation: How could there be a heavenly realm, a human realm, an animal realm, a hungry ghost, or a hell realm?"

source_sentence: 佛告解釋菩薩曰：「止止！
translation: The Buddha told the Explanation Bodhisattva, "Stop, stop!

source_sentence: 族姓子！
translation: sons of a great clan!

source_sentence: 吾先已說得人身者，不說餘道也。」
translation: I've already said that those who attain the human body will not explain the rest of the path."

source_sentence: 爾時，解釋菩薩復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the Explanation Bodhisattva again said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 頗有菩薩摩訶薩發弘誓心，一日之中使五趣眾生同己同日成佛不乎？」
translation: Could it be that a bodhisattva-mahāsattva makes a great vow to cause sentient beings in the five destinies to become buddhas on the same day as himself?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「無也。
translation: He answered, "No. Why is that?

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 眾生性行志趣不同，豈當以餓鬼、畜生、地獄形成佛耶？
translation: Since the nature and actions of sentient beings differ in their aspirations, should they be formed into buddhas by means of hungry ghosts, animals, or hells?

source_sentence: 此事不然。
translation: This is not the case.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 終不以非身得成人中尊，權化示現可假遍濟。」
translation: Never will a person not be honored among men for not being himself, and expedient transformation manifestations can be assumed to be pervasive relief."

source_sentence: 佛復告解釋菩薩曰：「無數諸佛過去本發弘誓心，令一切眾生有形之類及虛空界，悉令成佛盡般泥洹。
translation: The Buddha again told the Explanation Bodhisattva, "Countless buddhas in the past have made a great vow to cause all sentient beings of all shapes and sizes and in the realm of space to become buddhas and completely extinguish nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 然彼如來、至真、等正覺，即於其日先化三趣眾生，拔其苦本盡復人身，得人道已，諸根具足六情完具，然後一日之中同成佛道，眾相具足，如我今日如來、至真、等正覺，神智自在辯才無礙，悉取滅度。」
translation: However, the Tathāgata, the Most True, and the Completely Enlightened One was the one who first transformed sentient beings in the three destinies, uprooted their roots of suffering, returned them to the human condition, attained the human path, was endowed with the faculties and complete fulfillment of the six emotions, and then became buddhas together in a single day, complete with all characteristics, just as I am today, the Tathāgata, the Most True, and the Completely Enlightened One has unimpeded intelligence, unimpeded eloquence, and has completely achieved extinction."

source_sentence: 爾時，解釋菩薩白佛言：「弘誓菩薩教化眾生，其中苦行經無量劫。
translation: It was then that the Explanation Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "The Great Vow Bodhisattva teaches and transforms sentient beings, in which ascetic practices pass through measureless eons.

source_sentence: 何以故不即於三趣眾生悉令得佛道乎？」
translation: Why is it that it doesn't immediately cause all sentient beings in the three destinies to attain the Buddha Way?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「不可成道。
translation: The Buddha said, "You can't achieve enlightenment.

source_sentence: 云何？
translation: How is that?

source_sentence: 族姓子！
translation: sons of a great clan!

source_sentence: 此三趣道非三善道。
translation: "These three destinies are not the three good destinies.

source_sentence: 云何欲於中得成佛道乎？
translation: How do you want to attain the Buddha Way in them?

source_sentence: 此事不然。
translation: This is not the case.

source_sentence: 猶如有人欲求七寶，捨七寶[卄/積]反從空求，此人能獲不乎？」
translation: It's like a person who wants to pursue the seven treasures, but they abandon the seven [twenty/generous] treasures and pursue them from emptiness instead.

source_sentence: 答曰：「不也。
translation: They replied, "No.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是如是。
translation: The Buddha said, "So it is, so it is.

source_sentence: 族姓子！
translation: Clansmen!

source_sentence: 欲使三趣眾生成佛道者，此事不然。」
translation: This is not the case for someone who wants to make sentient beings in the three destinies become buddhas."

source_sentence: 菩薩瓔珞經因緣品第十
translation: Tenth Chapter of the Causes and Conditions of the Pusa Yingluojing

source_sentence: 佛告族姓子：「若有善男子、善女人，受持諷誦定眼識、定耳識者，便獲十功德。
translation: The Buddha told the clansmen, "If there are good men and good women who memorize and recite the chanting of the eye consciousness and the ear consciousness, they'll attain ten virtues.

source_sentence: 云何為十？
translation: What are the ten?

source_sentence: 於是菩薩摩訶薩以無等心獲虛空像，不以言教教化眾生淨佛國土。
translation: Thus, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains the image of space with an unequalled mind and doesn't teach sentient beings to purify the Buddha's land with words.

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人自知無數形識本末，知其虛寂悉無所有，起無生法忍。
translation: Good sons and good women know the origin and end of the consciousness of incalculable form, know that its voidness and quiescence are completely nonexistent, and give rise to the tolerance of the nonarising of qualities.

source_sentence: 「復次，族姓子！
translation: "Furthermore, clansmen!

source_sentence: 若有菩薩摩訶薩當坐道場，便能具足法界清淨。
translation: If there's a bodhisattva who's sitting on the site of enlightenment, he or she will be able to fully purify the Dharma realm.

source_sentence: 但為如來一相無形，或有菩薩得一法印，演說無量如來法教，非從師受自然而覺。
translation: It's just that the Tathāgata has one characteristic and no form, or maybe there's a bodhisattva who attains one seal of the Dharma and explains measureless teachings of the Tathāgata's Dharma, rather than naturally awakening from receiving them from a teacher.

source_sentence: 「復次，族姓子！
translation: "Furthermore, clansmen!

source_sentence: 行一法本廣大無底，以無相法生諸法本。
translation: The basis of the practice of a single dharma is vast and bottomless, and it's because of the markless dharma that the dharmas are born.

source_sentence: 云何無相生有相？」
translation: How does the absence of marks give rise to marks?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「如外有色，有青、有白、有赤、有黑、有黃。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Just as there are external colors, there's blue, white, red, black, and yellow."

source_sentence: 解釋菩薩言：「如來所說神在虛空，非過去當來現在，亦無有五陰名。
translation: The Explanation Bodhisattva said, "The Tathāgata teaches that the soul exists in space, isn't past, future, and present, and doesn't have the names of the five aggregates.

source_sentence: 云何言青、黃、赤、白、黑？」
translation: How do you say blue, yellow, red, white, and black?"

source_sentence: 「此因緣法不可思議，由眾生自起緣想，有行則有識，由識生癡則成人身。」
translation: "This is an unfathomable conditioned dharma in which sentient beings themselves give rise to conditioned thoughts, and when there's volition, there's consciousness, and from that consciousness arises delusion, which then becomes a human being."

source_sentence: 解釋菩薩白佛言：「如世尊言：『虛空無形，由四大色地水火風而有色。』
translation: The Explanation Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Just as the Bhagavān said, 'Space has no form, but from the four great forms, earth, water, fire, and wind, there is form.'

source_sentence: 今問如來，云何名曰地、水、火、風、青、黃、白、黑？
translation: Now, I'd like to ask the Tathāgata, what are they called, 'earth, water, fire, wind, blue, yellow, white, and black?'

source_sentence: 如世尊言：『如青、黃、白、黑空識在空中。』
translation: As the Bhagavān said, 'It's like the consciousnesses blue, yellow, white, and black are empty in the air.'

source_sentence: 何以不說，青、黃、赤、白中，青、黃、赤、白盡非空耶？」
translation: Why isn't it said that of the blue, yellow, red, and white, the blue, yellow, red, and white are all nonempty?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「不然。
translation: They replied, "No.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 各各自空，空性不知有性，有性不知無性。
translation: Each is empty, doesn't know the nature of existence when it's empty, and doesn't know the nature of nonexistence when it's existent.

source_sentence: 猶如菩薩摩訶薩一念之頃，知無量恒沙剎土諸佛世界，成劫敗劫一一知之。
translation: It's like the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who, in a moment of thought, knows measureless buddha-lands and buddha-realms, knowing each one in an eon of formation and an eon of decay.

source_sentence: 了知其中而無他相，諸法因緣自生自滅，本我因空生生不滅。
translation: He fully understands that there are no characteristics of others, that the causes and conditions of all things arise and cease on their own, and that the original self arises and doesn't cease because of emptiness.

source_sentence: 復觀無量阿僧祇剎土，觀見諸菩薩受慧莊嚴剎土，淨眾生種，因彼佛國土演布道教。
translation: He also observes measureless incalculable buddha-lands and observes the buddha-lands adorned by the wisdom of bodhisattvas, which purifies the seeds of sentient beings and disseminates the teaching of the Way because of those buddha-lands.

source_sentence: 阿僧祇諸佛如來，盡知所出之處，一一分別亦無我想。
translation: These incalculably long buddha-tathāgatas know all the places from which they arise, and there's no conception of self in any of them.

source_sentence: 復於諸佛如來、至真、等正覺，聞深法要奉持承受，不捨諸法之本。
translation: Furthermore, at those buddha-tathāgatas, the supreme truths, and the perfectly enlightened, they hear the profound teaching, retain it, and bear it, and don't abandon the foundations of the teachings.

source_sentence: 「爾時，菩薩亦不自見有我無我，行菩薩行不見有行，是謂因有起於無相，於中不自滅相。
translation: "At the time, the bodhisattva doesn't see for himself that there's a self and no self, and he doesn't see any form of action when he's practicing bodhisattva practices, which is called the cause of existence that arises from marklessness and doesn't cease to have marks of its own.

source_sentence: 身雖生觀亦不自見無所覺知，已無所覺亦無此念起吾我想，自校計已便能分別一切諸法。
translation: Even though the body arises from contemplation, it doesn't see for itself that there's no perception, and once there's no perception, there's no such thought that gives rise to the idea of self, and after calibrating it for itself, it's then able to discern all dharmas.

source_sentence: 無明緣行，行緣識，識緣名色，名色緣更樂，乃至生老死亦復如是。
translation: It's likewise with nescience in reference to form, form in reference to consciousness, consciousness in reference to name-and-form, and name-and-form in reference to further pleasure, up to birth, old age, and death.

source_sentence: 爾時，具行菩薩復作是念：『一切諸法因緣相生、因緣相滅。』
translation: At that point, the practicing bodhisattva again thinks, 'All dharmas arise by causation and cease by causation.'

source_sentence: 從初發意乃至成佛，一一觀了諸法之相，緣生則生、緣滅則滅，無明滅則行滅，行滅則識滅，識滅則名色滅，名色滅則更樂滅，更樂滅則愛滅，愛滅則受滅，受滅則有滅，有滅則生滅，生滅則老病死憂悲苦惱滅。
translation: From the time he first arouses his intention until he becomes a buddha, he observes the characteristics of each dharma one by one, and when conditions arise, they arise; when conditions cease, they cease; when conditions cease, consciousness ceases; when consciousness ceases, name-and-form ceases; when name-and-form ceases, more pleasures cease; when more pleasures cease, craving ceases; when craving ceases, feelings cease; when feelings cease, existence ceases; when existence ceases, birth ceases; when birth ceases, old age, illness, death, grief, sorrow, pain, and vexation cease.

source_sentence: 取要言之、五盛陰眾行之本，無猗不可猗，然知起所從來處，於彼自省觀諸法界，法慧清淨不捨辯才。
translation: To summarize, the root of all the activities of the five proliferating aggregates is unconfused and unconfused, but he knows where it comes from, reflects on it himself, and observes the Dharma realm, and his Dharma wisdom is purified without abandoning his eloquence.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩思惟分別十二因緣，云何無明緣行？
translation: What are the twelve causes and conditions that the bodhisattva Mahāsattva contemplates and discerns as the conditioned formations of ignorance?

source_sentence: 於是善男子、女人，由無明本造善惡行，盡生十二諸不善本，漸漸成五盛形，是謂無明緣行。」
translation: Thus, good sons and women who create good and bad deeds from their ignorant roots will end up with twelve unwholesome roots that gradually become the five proliferating forms, which are called the conditioned deeds of ignorance."

source_sentence: 爾時，過行比丘即從座起，偏露右臂右膝著地，叉手白佛言：「如我所學十二因緣甚深之法，我今當說。
translation: At that point, the monk Faixing then rose from his seat, bared his right arm and knelt on his right knee, saluted the Buddha with his palms together, and said, "Now, I will explain the profound teaching of twelve causes and conditions as I've studied them.

source_sentence: 無明緣行便生十二，行緣識便生十二，識緣名色便生十二，名色緣更樂便生十二，更樂緣六入便生十二，六入緣愛便生十二，愛緣受便生十二，受緣有便生十二，有緣生老病死憂悲苦惱復生十二。
translation: Twelve arises from nescience conditioned by form, twelve arises from form conditioned by consciousness, twelve arises from consciousness conditioned by name-and-form, twelve arises from name-and-form conditioned by more pleasures, twelve arises from the six sense-fields conditioned by more pleasures, twelve arises from the six sense-fields conditioned by craving, twelve arises from craving conditioned by feeling, twelve arises from feeling conditioned by existence, twelve arises from existence conditioned by birth, old age, illness, death, sorrow, pain, and vexation.

source_sentence: 如我所解十二因緣，癡滅則行滅，行滅則識滅，識滅則名色滅，名色滅則更樂滅，更樂滅則六入滅，六入滅則愛滅，愛滅則受滅，受滅則有滅，有滅則生老病死憂悲苦惱滅。」
translation: As I've explained the 12 causes and conditions, when delusion ceases, form ceases, form ceases, consciousness ceases, name-and-form ceases, more pleasures cease, more pleasures cease, the six sense-fields cease, love ceases when the six sense-fields cease, feeling ceases, existence ceases when feeling ceases, and grief, sorrow, pain, and vexation cease when existence ceases."

source_sentence: 佛言：「比丘！
translation: The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 不壞法相，猶如幻師住於此地現其幻法，然彼幻法不損此地，地亦不損幻法。
translation: "The characteristic of indestructible phenomena is like an illusionist who lives here and manifests his illusory qualities, but those illusory qualities don't harm this place, and the earth doesn't harm the illusory qualities.

source_sentence: 然此幻師造作此化無有晝夜，其有見此幻者悉皆信解。
translation: Still, this illusionist creates this transformation without day or night, and anyone who sees this illusion is completely convinced.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩亦復如是，以神足力分別十二因緣。
translation: *Bodhisattva Mahāsattva likewise discerns twelve causes and conditions with the power of his spiritual abilities.

source_sentence: 無佛境界現其剎土，本無有世今現有世，復以有佛剎土能現無佛剎土，以無色剎土現有形色，不以一壞二，不以二壞一。
translation: A buddha-less realm manifests itself as a buddha-lands, a past world that didn't exist and a present world, a buddha-lands that exist and a formless buddha-lands that have form and form, and one doesn't destroy two by one and one doesn't destroy one by two.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如彼幻法能使一切世界盡如幻術，猶如一切世界隨人所喜盡為幻法，幻有若干非有一法。
translation: "Thus, an illusory dharma can cause all the worlds to completely appear as illusory tricks, just as all the worlds are illusory dharmas according to people's desires, and there are several illusory things, not just one.

source_sentence: 「或有幻法名曰無量諸法門，菩薩得此幻法者，便能現一切諸法皆如幻法，已得幻法便得幻智而不忘失，已得幻智便得幻行能盡眾苦。
translation: "Perhaps there's an illusory dharma called the approach of measureless dharmas, and when a bodhisattva attains this illusory dharma, he'll be able to show that all dharmas are illusory, and once he attains the illusory dharma, he'll attain the knowledge of illusions and won't forget it, and once he attains the knowledge of illusions, he'll attain the practice of illusions that can end all suffering.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩已獲幻智行幻，便能於中以幻智盡能分別眾行，一一思惟不失本際，如彼幻法不依內地，現於外法亦不依外，使諸眾生現有內法。
translation: Once he has acquired the knowledge of illusions and practices illusions, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva can use that knowledge of illusions to completely discern the many practices in them, contemplating them one by one without losing their original state, just as the illusory dharmas don't rely on the inside, and they appear as external dharmas that don't rely on the outside, causing sentient beings to appear as internal dharmas.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩亦復如是，不以空性內外分別，言：『我當越一切世界。』
translation: So too, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva doesn't discriminate between internal and external emptiness on the basis of emptiness, saying, 'I will transcend all worlds.'

source_sentence: 亦不以世界在內外空法。
translation: Nor does he think of the worlds as empty dharmas inside and outside.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 虛空性爾不壞法界，法界不壞空性。
translation: "The nature of space doesn't destroy the Dharma realm, and the Dharma realm doesn't destroy the nature of space.

source_sentence: 「菩薩摩訶薩於中得虛空性，種種觀一切法界，亦不觀法界亦不壞法界，不但不見此世界有若干形，亦不見眾生善行惡行之報，一一分別究尋其事，性空自爾無能使爾。
translation: "When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains the nature of space in this, he observes all the realms of reality in various ways, and he doesn't observe the realm of reality or destroy the realm of reality.

source_sentence: 觀已復觀分別三有，於中計校十二因緣，由癡起眼識有三行事。
translation: After observing this, he also observes and discerns the three existences, discriminating twelve causes and conditions within them, and the visual consciousness arisen from delusion has three actions.

source_sentence: 云何為三？
translation: What are the three?

source_sentence: 猶如，族姓子！
translation: Just like, a son of the clan!

source_sentence: 眼見外色，若善不善盡不分別，斯由本識無明行染。
translation: When the eye sees external form, it doesn't discriminate good and unskillful qualities altogether, which are defiled by the nescience of this consciousness and its activity.

source_sentence: 或復善男子、善女人，起身口意行三不善法，意漸自悟：『咄我本所造，由無明本今乃致十二因緣。』
translation: Perhaps a good man or woman initiates the three unskillful deeds of body, speech, and thought, and gradually realizes on their own, 'Duh, I originally created this, and it's because of ignorance that I've now caused 12 causes and conditions.'

source_sentence: 知從無明不能自改。
translation: They know that it's because of ignorance that they can't change on their own.

source_sentence: 「復次，善男子、善女人由癡致行，眾罪根原由罪而生：『我今當念寂靜定意，觀此十二因緣為由癡耶？
translation: "Furthermore, when good sons and good women act out of delusion, the root of many sins arises from sin: 'Now, I must be mindful of calm concentration and examine these twelve causes and conditions because of delusion.

source_sentence: 為從行乎？』
translation: Do you follow the practice?'

source_sentence: 復自思惟：『無明澹靜隱匿之法，何由能出諸緣著乎？
translation: Again, he thought, 'How can the calm and withdrawn state of nescience be freed from the attachments that are contingent on it?'

source_sentence: 非我身口行造，無由得生？』
translation: Is it not because of my physical or verbal actions that there's no way it could come into being?'

source_sentence: 是謂菩薩摩訶薩分別三行而無所有。
translation: This is called the bodhisattva-mahāsattva discriminating three actions without having any.

source_sentence: 「菩薩摩訶薩得空觀定意，分別十二因緣，緣癡有行便有緣報，癡非本原，何由而有行乎？
translation: "When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains the concentration of contemplation on emptiness and discerns twelve causes and conditions, conditioned by delusion there are conditioned rewards when there are formations, and delusion is not the origin, so how could there be formations?

source_sentence: 身口意法三事相因乃生諸法。
translation: The three things that cause the body, speech, mind, and dharmas to come into being are the dharmas.

source_sentence: 所以如來於無數劫，分別思惟十二因緣，今得成佛始得信解。
translation: That's why the Tathāgata has spent countless eons discriminating and contemplating twelve causes and conditions, and now he's attained Buddhahood before he attains faith and understanding.

source_sentence: 吾初發意求菩薩道，捨身受身分別十二因緣，思惟苦本未盡其原。
translation: When I first set out to pursue the bodhisattva path, I abandoned my body to experience identity and discriminate among the twelve causes and conditions, thinking about the root of suffering and not yet exhausting its origin.

source_sentence: 今我成如來、至真、等正覺，乃得暢達十二因緣。」
translation: Now, when I've become a tathāgata, supremely true, and perfectly enlightened, I've been able to fully comprehend the twelve causes and conditions."

source_sentence: 佛復告過行比丘：「汝今雖在如來前說十二因緣，未能具其原本。
translation: The Buddha again addressed the monk of superknowledges, "Even though you've explained the twelve causes and conditions before the Tathāgata, you haven't fully grasped their original source.

source_sentence: 何以故本無？
translation: Why is it originally nonexistent?

source_sentence: 如來、至真、等正覺住壽經恒沙劫，宣說十二因緣猶不能盡，何況汝今欲得盡乎？」
translation: The Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, and the Completely Awakened One have lived for eons and eons, but they still haven't exhausted the twelve causes and conditions they've explained, so why would you want to exhaust them now?"

source_sentence: 爾時，彼比丘在如來前極懷慚愧：「將我得無失神足乎？」
translation: The monk then appeared before the Tathāgata with a sense of shame, "Will I attain supernormal power without losing it?"

source_sentence: 即從座起頭面禮世尊足，便退而去。
translation: He rose from his seat, bowed his head to the Bhagavān's feet, and withdrew.

source_sentence: 菩薩瓔珞經心品第十一
translation: Pusa yingluo jingxin pin 11

source_sentence: 爾時，座上諸欲天人、諸色天人、天、龍、鬼神、乾沓惒、阿須倫、迦留羅、旃陀羅、摩休勒，聞如來、至真、等正覺說此甚深之法，皆有渴仰欲得見如來正心定意。
translation: At the time, the gods of desire, gods of form, gods, dragons, ghosts, gods of India, asuras, garuḍas, caṇḍalas, caṇḍalas, and mahoras heard the Tathāgata, the Zhijin, and the Completely Awakened One teach this very profound Dharma, and they all longed to see the Tathāgata's correct concentration of mind.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知眾生心中所念，欲令眾會心定三昧。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān knew what was in the minds of the sentient beings and wanted to cause them to assemble in the concentration of mind.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即於座上入面現定意，令諸菩薩摩訶薩皆悉見之。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān entered the seat with his face in front of him and showed them the concentrated mind, so that the bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas could all see it.

source_sentence: 去此十五江河沙數，有佛土名曰如幻，佛名等心如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，號佛、世尊。
translation: Fifteen rivers and sands away, there's a Buddha-land named Ruofang, and the Buddha's name is Equanimous Mind Tathāgata, Zhizhen, Equally Perfect Enlightenment, Mingxing Cheng, Shanga, Shijian Jie, Unsurpassed Person, Wayfarer, Teacher of Gods and People, and he's called the Buddha, the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 彼國清淨不猗想著，無有餓鬼、畜生、地獄道，所行純厚不自計我，心不趣小亦無聲聞辟支佛音。
translation: That country is pure, free of indifferent attachments, has no hungry ghosts, animals, or the path to hell, is pure in its ways, doesn't impute itself, and doesn't have a mind aiming for the lesser or the voice of a śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 令一切會皆悉見之。
translation: He causes them to be seen by all assemblies.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊從彼定起，復入月盛定意，令一切眾生盡見金色，悉聞十方諸佛說無相行：「云何為無相？
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān rose from that concentration and again entered the concentration of the full moon, causing all sentient beings to see gold and hear the buddhas of the ten directions teach the formless practice, "What is formlessness?

source_sentence: 諸法寂然澹泊無形，諸法不起忍諸恚怒，諸法攝心不起外想，諸法定意現已國淨，諸法善觀不以劫數為限，諸法樂行永離恩愛，諸法現明不生癡想。
translation: The states are quiescent, calm, and formless, the states don't arise from tolerating anger, the states collect the mind and don't give rise to external perceptions, the states are purified by the manifestation of the mind, the states are well-observed and not limited by the number of eons, the states practice happily and are always free of craving, and the states are clearly manifested and don't give rise to deluded perceptions.

source_sentence: 諸法去貪，具足施度無極；諸法無有所犯，具足戒度無極；諸法不起恚想，具足忍度無極；諸法精進無有懈怠，具足進度無極；諸法不興亂意，攝心不起常樂於禪，具足禪度無極；諸法盡除愚惑無他異念，具足智度無極。
translation: They are free of craving, which fulfills the limit of generosity; they are free of transgressions, which fulfills the limit of precepts; they cease thoughts of anger, which fulfills the limit of forbearance; they make effort without laziness, which fulfills the limit of progress; they don't give rise to confused thoughts, collect their minds and don't give rise to constant delight in meditation, which fulfills the limit of the meditation degree; and they end ignorance and don't have other kinds of thoughts, which fulfills the limit of the wisdom degree.

source_sentence: 「復有名四意止，菩薩摩訶薩所修行法。
translation: "Also, there are four names for calming the mind, which are cultivated by the bodhisattvas, the great beings, and the methods they practice.

source_sentence: 云何為四意止？
translation: What are the four kinds of mental stabilization?

source_sentence: 若有善男子、女人，分別內身意止，從頭至足一一分別生不淨觀，自觀己身觀他人身，自觀己心觀他人心，內外諸法悉皆如是。
translation: If there are good men and women who discriminate the internal body and mind and stop, discriminating one part from head to toe to produce an impure contemplation, contemplate their own bodies and contemplate the bodies of others, and contemplate their own minds and contemplate the minds of others, internal and external dharmas are all like that.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩復自觀諸法：四意斷、四神足、五根、五力、七覺意、八賢聖道，是謂菩薩摩訶薩無相行。」
translation: The bodhisattva Mahāsattva also observes these things on his own: the four eliminations of mind, the four miraculous powers, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven awakened thoughts, and the eight noble paths, which are called the markless actions of the bodhisattva Mahāsattva."

source_sentence: 佛復告族姓子：「菩薩摩訶薩自觀身已觀他人身，一一分別從頭至足起不淨想，是謂菩薩摩訶薩觀內外身悉無所有。」
translation: The Buddha again told the clansman, "After the bodhisattva observes his own body and observes the bodies of others, he discriminates one part from head to toe and gives rise to an impure conception, which is called the bodhisattva's observation that the internal and external bodies are all without possessions."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說此偈而歎頌曰：「不猗心意識，　　分別諸行本，　道存無想念，　　乃應賢聖諦。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān spoke this verse and praised it, saying, "Impure mind and consciousness discriminate the basis of conditioned phenomena, and the path remains without conceptions, so it's worthy of the noble truth.

source_sentence: 佛慧無邊涯，　　不見有合離，　成佛由無相，　　乃應果實行。
translation: The Buddha's wisdom has no limit, doesn't see any conjunction or separation, and becomes buddha because of the absence of marks, which should be the result of practice.

source_sentence: 佛道本無二，　　亦復無一相，　真人慈善普，　　示現若干法。
translation: The Buddha-Path is originally nondual, yet it also has no single aspect, and true beings are universally charitable, revealing a variety of dharmas.

source_sentence: 本我不造我，　　染有成五陰，　聖諦慧無量，　　進趣自滅意。
translation: The original self doesn't create a self, defiled existence forms the five aggregates, and the wisdom of the noble truths is immeasurable as he advances to his own will to cease.

source_sentence: 不有亦不無，　　生死起染著，　滅相自成佛，　　故號天中天。
translation: Neither existent nor nonexistent, defiled attachments arise in birth-and-death, and the cessation of characteristics becomes a buddha on its own, which is why it's called the god of gods.

source_sentence: 生值人道難，　　六根完具難，　滅十二緣難，　　生天受福難。
translation: It's difficult to be born into a human existence, difficult to complete the six faculties, difficult to cease the 12 conditions, and difficult to be born in a heavenly existence and receive merit.

source_sentence: 遭遇賢聖難，　　入定除想難，　觀內外身難，　　面受聖教難。」
translation: It's difficult to encounter good men and sages, difficult to enter concentration and rid oneself of perceptions, difficult to contemplate the internal and external bodies, and difficult to face-to-face accept the noble teaching."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊說此偈已，座上諸天、人民、天龍、鬼神、八部之眾，皆發無上正真道意，復有無數眾生得不起法忍也。
translation: After the Bhagavān spoke this verse, the gods, people, gods, dragons, spirits, and the eight groups of people on the throne all aroused the intention for the unsurpassed true path, and countless other sentient beings attained the patience of the nonarising Dharma.

source_sentence: ◎菩薩瓔珞經◎四聖諦品第十二爾時，佛告文殊師利：「過去無數阿僧祇劫有佛，名大身如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，號佛、世尊。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Mañjuśrī, "There was a Buddha in the incalculably long eon of the past who was called the Great Body Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, the Perfect Enlightenment, the Becoming of Clear Practices, the Well Gone, the Worldly Understanding, the Unsurpassed One, the Way, the Dharma Controller, the Teacher of Gods and People, and who was called the Buddha, the World Honored One.

source_sentence: 剎名空寂，正於此處成無上等正覺，與四部眾說微妙法四賢聖諦，廣化眾生皆令至無餘泥洹界而取滅度。
translation: The blazon is called emptiness, and it's here that he becomes unsurpassed and perfectly awakened, speaks to four groups of people about the subtle Dharma and four noble truths, and widely converts sentient beings, bringing them all to the sphere of nirvāṇa without remainder and bringing about their extinction.

source_sentence: 「云何四聖諦？
translation: "What are the four noble truths?

source_sentence: 一為無量聖諦，菩薩得此聖諦者，一念之中自滅心垢亦能滅他心垢，不見塵垢有盡無盡；二名行盡聖諦，菩薩得此聖諦者，一念之中盡令眾生覺了身口意行，若善、若惡盡趣道門，悉令眾生至無餘泥洹界；三名速疾聖諦，菩薩得此聖諦者，能使一切眾生彈指之頃盡成佛道，無限無量不可稱數一日成道，復令無數阿僧祇剎土眾生之類，各生善心興敬供養諸佛世尊，香華繒綵作倡伎樂，阿僧祇諸佛剎土化作一寶蓋，而用供養出過諸天世人上，盡持天上自然飲食、衣被、床、臥具、病瘦、醫藥，一念之頃悉能成辦；四名曰等聖諦，菩薩得此聖諦者，能使一切眾生盡同一趣無若干相，於無餘泥洹界而般泥洹，猶如焰幻野馬，世界空寂無形不可獲持。
translation: 一為無量聖諦，菩薩得此聖諦者，一念之中自滅心垢亦能滅他心垢，不見塵垢有盡無盡；二名行盡聖諦，菩薩得此聖諦者，一念之中盡令眾生覺了身口意行，若善、若惡盡趣道門，悉令眾生至無餘泥洹界；三名速疾聖諦，菩薩得此聖諦者，能使一切眾生彈指之頃盡成佛道，無限無量不可稱數一日成道，復令無數阿僧祇剎土眾生之類，各生善心興敬供養諸佛世尊，香華繒綵作倡伎樂，阿僧祇諸佛剎土化作一寶蓋，而用供養出過諸天世人上，盡持天上自然飲食、衣被、床、臥具、病瘦、醫藥，一念之頃悉能成辦；四名曰等聖諦，菩薩得此聖諦者，能使一切眾生盡同一趣無若干相，於無餘泥洹界而般泥洹，猶如焰幻野馬，世界空寂無形不可獲持。

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩亦復如是，教化眾生淨佛國土，亦不見眾生有得度者，亦復不見受化者，非不有眾生非不無眾生，非不有淨眾生非不無淨眾生，非不有濁非不無濁，非不有受胎非不無受胎，非不有非不無有，非不有生死非不無生死，一一分別悉無所有，知十二因緣亦復如是，從癡至十二因緣非有非無，猶如野馬，世界不可獲持無近無遠，雖化眾生不見有化。
translation: *Bodhisattva Mahāsattva also thus teaches sentient beings to purify the Buddha's land, but he doesn't see any sentient beings who've been saved, and he doesn't see any who've been trained, whether there are no sentient beings or no sentient beings, neither are there no pure sentient beings or no pure sentient beings, neither are there turbidities or no turbidities, neither are there womb reception or no womb reception, neither are there nor no existences, neither are there birth-and-death nor no birth-and-death, and none of them are separately possessed.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩亦復如是，觀諸如來、至真、等正覺，不見有起不見有滅，亦不有相亦不無相。
translation: It's likewise for the bodhisattvas, Mahāsattvas, to observe that the Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, and the Completely Awakened One don't see anything arising and don't see anything ceasing, nor do they have marks or lack marks.

source_sentence: 如來、至真、等正覺以無相之法，教化眾生淨佛國土。
translation: The Tathāgata, the Most True, and the Completely Awakened One use teachings without marks to purify the Buddha's land for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 雖有佛無有佛想，雖有法無有法想，雖有比丘僧無有比丘僧想，是謂，文殊師利！
translation: Although there are buddhas, there's no conception of buddhas, although there are dharmas, there's no conception of dharmas, and although there are monks and nuns, there's no conception of monks and nuns, which is called, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩已得無相法者，住不退轉而無有礙。
translation: "When a bodhisattva-mahāsattva has attained the teaching of no characteristics, he abides in nonretrogression without any obstruction.

source_sentence: 譬如有人於夢中或為國王、或為轉輪聖王，覺已便憶夢中所作亦不忘失。
translation: It's like a person who is a king or a wheel-turning sage king in a dream and then recalls what they did in the dream after awakening and doesn't forget it.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩亦復如是，觀諸眾生成如來、至真、等正覺，亦不見有成相，亦不見無成相。」
translation: In the same way, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva observes that all sentient beings become tathāgatas, supremely true, and perfectly enlightened, and he doesn't see the mark of becoming or the mark of no becoming."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸會大眾：「爾時，大身如來，說法清淨無形不可見，豈異人乎？
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the assembly, "At the time, the great-bodied Tathāgata who teaches the pure Dharma is formless and invisible, isn't he someone else?

source_sentence: 莫造斯觀。
translation: Don't create this contemplation.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 爾時大身如來，今文殊師利是。」
translation: At the time, the Mahābodhi-tathāgata was Mañjuśrī."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊便說此偈言：「過去無數世，　　佛號大身尊，　於此成正覺，　　無有邪部行。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke this verse, saying, "In countless past lives, the Buddha was called the Great Body Honored One, and he became perfectly awakened here, with no mistaken partial practices.

source_sentence: 恒以無相法，　　分別四聖諦，　權現遊世界，　　現有所諮受。
translation: He always discriminated the four noble truths by means of markless dharmas, traveled the world in expedient manifestation, and now has something to consult.

source_sentence: 佛道不思議，　　神力不可極，　教化眾生類，　　盡同為一相。
translation: The Buddha's path is inconceivable, his spiritual powers are inexhaustible, and the types of sentient beings he teaches are all the same in their single aspect.

source_sentence: 吾今自成佛，　　三界第一尊，　不為彼所染，　　不更生老死。」
translation: Now, I have become a buddha myself, the highest honored one in the three realms, not stained by them, and not subject to rebirth through old age and death."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊說此偈已，有無量眾生皆發無上正真道意。
translation: After the Bhagavān spoke this verse, measureless sentient beings aroused the intention for the unsurpassed true path.

source_sentence: 菩薩瓔珞經成道品第十三
translation: Pusa yingluo jingchengdao pin di xiii

source_sentence: 爾時，有菩薩名無畏，曾供養過去無數諸佛，已得總持分別三世成敗所趣，即從座起偏露右臂，叉手長跪，白佛言：「唯然，世尊！
translation: At the time, a bodhisattva named Fearless, who had made offerings to countless buddhas in the past and had attained the ability to comprehensively discern the destinies of success and failure in the three times, rose from his seat, bared his right arm, knelt down with his palms together, and said to the Buddha, "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今聞如來、至真、等正覺說四賢聖難有之法，未曾所聞、未曾所見。
translation: "Now, I've heard the Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, and the Completely Awakened One teach four noble and difficult things that have never been heard or seen before.

source_sentence: 若有善男子、善女人，受持諷誦四聖諦名者，便能與人作良祐福田。
translation: If good men and good women accept, recite, and chant the names of the four noble truths, they'll be able to make a virtuous field of blessings for others.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此善男子、女人，興建弘誓不自為身，欲於空際濟度眾生，皆得至無餘泥洹界而般泥洹。
translation: "This good man or woman builds a great vow not to make himself or herself a body and wants to save sentient beings in the realm of emptiness, so they can all reach the sphere of nirvāṇa without remainder and then [enter] parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩得此四聖諦者，觀了眾生悉無所有，空觀菩薩不自有身亦無眾生，執弘誓之心，以空舉空，於無數劫積功累德，觀見諸佛出現於世。
translation: When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva attains these four noble truths, he observes that all sentient beings lack existence, observes emptiness as a bodhisattva's lack of body and lack of sentient beings, adheres to the great vow, uses emptiness to lift up emptiness, and accumulates merit over countless eons to see the buddhas appear in the world.

source_sentence: 分別諸法無有形貌，不著世利，利衰毀譽稱譏苦樂，亦知眾生我人壽命、當來過去現在心識，一一分別能使成就。」
translation: He discerns that all dharmas lack form, doesn't attach to worldly gain, profit and loss, disparagement, praise and blame, and pain and pleasure, and knows that each of sentient beings, our personal lifespan, and future, past, and present minds and consciousnesses can be accomplished separately."

source_sentence: 爾時，無畏菩薩復白佛言：「云何？
translation: At that point, the fearless bodhisattva again said to the Buddha, "What is it?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 眾生之類不可稱記，非是羅漢辟支所及，過去恒沙無央數佛，頗有發意求菩薩道，言：『我久久當成無上正真之道，我能盡虛空際知虛空際眾生根本，已能分別虛空眾生，復能分別識有趣無趣，如是等眾生盡令一日之中能使成道。』
translation: There are indescribable types of sentient beings beyond the reach of arhats and pratyekbuddhas, and there were quite a few buddhas in the past who had the intention to pursue the bodhisattva path and said, 'A long time from now, I will achieve the unsurpassed true path; I'll be able to exhaust the extent of space and know the root of sentient beings in the extent of space; I'll be able to discern sentient beings in space; I'll be able to discern the interesting and aimless aspects of consciousness; and such sentient beings will be able to achieve the path in a single day.'

source_sentence: 有此不乎？」
translation: Isn't there such a thing?"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告無畏菩薩曰：「當來過去今現在識，非汝境界所能分別，今汝發問者皆佛威神。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the fearless bodhisattva, "Future consciousnesses, past and present, are beyond the ability of your objective realm to discern, and those who ask questions now are all the Buddha's authoritative power.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如來、至真、等正覺乃能一一宣暢深法。」
translation: The Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, and the Completely Enlightened One can then proclaim each one of these profound teachings."

source_sentence: 佛言：「族姓子！
translation: The Buddha said, "Clansman!

source_sentence: 過去識如汝所問，盡知識流轉天上人中四道，乃至八部識所經歷所趣盡能分別。」
translation: Past consciousnesses, as you've asked, exhaust knowledge of the four destinies of transmigration up in heaven, among humans, and up to the eightfold consciousness that passes through and enters can all be discerned."

source_sentence: 無畏菩薩白佛言：「如來、至真、等正覺發弘誓心，盡能拔濟過去當來今現在。
translation: The fearless bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "The Tathāgata, the supremely true, and the perfectly enlightened one has made a great vow to rescue as many as possible from the past, the future, and the present.

source_sentence: 云何一日之中盡得成佛耶？」
translation: How can they attain Buddhahood in a single day?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「無畏菩薩所問甚大，今當為汝一一分別，知其所趣所問。
translation: The Buddha said, "The fearless bodhisattva's questions are so great that I will now help you distinguish them one by one and know what they're about and what they're asking.

source_sentence: 過去識不於過去中使過去識令得成佛，不於現在中使現在識令得成佛，不於未來中使未來識得至成佛。
translation: A past consciousness doesn't cause a past consciousness to become a buddha in the past, doesn't cause a present consciousness to become a buddha in the present, and doesn't cause a future consciousness to reach buddhahood in the future.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 過去識非本過去識，未來識非未來識，現在識非現在識。
translation: Past consciousness is not this past consciousness, future consciousness is not future consciousness, and present consciousness is not present consciousness.

source_sentence: 「無畏菩薩當知，過去成佛有三事行。
translation: "The fearless bodhisattva should know that there are three things he did to become a buddha in the past.

source_sentence: 云何為三？
translation: What are the three?

source_sentence: 有初心、有生心、有眾生心。
translation: There's a beginner's mind, a mind that arises, and a mind of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 云何為初心？
translation: What is the beginner's mind?

source_sentence: 無畏菩薩當知，本無如來、至真、等正覺，即於彼而教化之，同日同時盡成佛道，是謂初心。
translation: The fearless bodhisattva should know that there is no Tathāgata, Supreme Truth, or Perfect Enlightenment in the past, so he teaches them and makes them all attain the Buddha Way at the same time on the same day, which is called the first mind.

source_sentence: 云何生心？
translation: What is the first mind?

source_sentence: 所謂生心者，已受塵垢方當滅心除垢。
translation: "It's called the mind that arises, and it's only after it's been defiled that it's possible to extinguish the defilement of the mind and remove it.

source_sentence: 云何為眾生心？
translation: What's the mind of sentient beings?

source_sentence: 如有眾生從劫至劫乃至百千劫，復盡無數生死塵勞；然此菩薩摩訶薩，要當滅彼無數塵勞，及濟無數眾生。
translation: "Suppose there are sentient beings who go from eon to eon and up to a hundred thousand eons, and then they end the countless dusts of birth-and-death; nevertheless, this bodhisattva-mahāsattva will extinguish countless of those dusts and labor and rescue countless sentient beings.

source_sentence: 是謂，無畏菩薩！
translation: This is called the Bodhisattva of Fearlessness!

source_sentence: 於過去中成就三事。
translation: In the past, they accomplished three things.

source_sentence: 「無畏當知，如來、至真、等正覺，於當來世亦當具三法。
translation: "Fearless, you should know that the Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, and the Completely Awakened One will also have three things in the future.

source_sentence: 云何為三？
translation: What are the three?

source_sentence: 如當來心未受現在是亦可進。
translation: As in the future, this is an advancement of mind not yet experienced in the present.

source_sentence: 復次，無畏！
translation: "Furthermore, fearless!

source_sentence: 未來心已經一日便有塵垢，菩薩摩訶薩要當滅一日塵垢。
translation: "One day in the future there'll be dirt in the mind, and the bodhisattva Mahāsattva will extinguish that dirt for one day.

source_sentence: 族姓子當知，未來移轉從一劫至百劫，乃至無數阿僧祇劫，如來、至真、等正覺知此身識及與塵勞，是謂於未來中當具此三法。」
translation: Clansmen, you should know that in the future, from one eon to a hundred eons and up to incalculably many incalculable eons, the Tathāgata, the Most True, and the Completely Awakened One will know this body consciousness and its dustiness, which is to say that these three things will be present in the future."

source_sentence: 佛復告族姓子：「如來、至真、等正覺，於現在中復當具是三法。
translation: The Buddha again told the clansman, "These are the three things that the Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, and the Completely Awakened One will again have in the present.

source_sentence: 云何為三？
translation: What are the three?

source_sentence: 初識現在未染塵勞，即令彼識一日滅度。
translation: When the first consciousness is present and untainted by defilement, that causes that consciousness to cease in a single day.

source_sentence: 若一、若二便生塵勞，能滅一二及與塵勞，然彼乃得成佛。」
translation: If one or two will then give rise to defilement, and if they can cease one, two, and defilement, then they'll become buddhas."

source_sentence: 佛復告族姓子：「若於現在，從一身至百千身生諸塵勞，是謂菩薩摩訶薩於現在中具足三法。」
translation: Again, the Buddha told the clansman, "If in the present, from one body to a hundred thousand bodies, dust and fatigue arise, this is called a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who fully possesses the three qualities in the present."

source_sentence: 佛復告無畏菩薩：「過去初心一日度者，即是過去普施如來、至真、等正覺。
translation: Again, the Buddha told the fearless bodhisattva, "Someone whose first mind was saved one day in the past is a Tathāgata who was universally bestowed, perfectly true, and perfectly enlightened in the past.

source_sentence: 過去生心蒙得度者，即是無等如來、至真、等正覺。
translation: Whoever was saved in the mind of past births is the peerless Tathāgata, the supreme truth, and the equal enlightenment.

source_sentence: 過去眾生蒙得濟者，即是原本如來、至真、等正覺。
translation: Someone who has been saved by sentient beings in the past is the original Tathāgata, the supreme truth, and the equal enlightenment.

source_sentence: 未來初心蒙得度者，即是空色如來、至真、等正覺。
translation: Those who will be liberated in the future in the first instance will be the Tathāgata who is emptiness in form, the supreme truth, and perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 未來一二蒙得度者，即是空門如來、至真、等正覺。
translation: The one or two in the future who will be liberated will be the emptiness-gate Tathāgata, the supreme truth, and the perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 未來無數身蒙得度者，即是定意如來、至真、等正覺。
translation: The person who will be liberated in an incalculable number of bodies in the future will be the concentrated mind, the Tathāgata, the supreme truth, and the perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 現在初心得度者，即是無身如來、至真、等正覺。
translation: The person who has attained salvation in the beginning now is the bodiless Tathāgata, the supreme truth, and perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 現在一二身得度者，即是善星宿如來、至真、等正覺。
translation: Now, someone who's been liberated in one or two bodies is the good astral tathāgata, the supreme truth, and the perfectly enlightened one.

source_sentence: 現在無數身得度者，即是月光如來、至真、等正覺。
translation: Now, someone who has attained salvation in an incalculable number of bodies is the moon-light Tathāgata, the supreme truth, and perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「云何？
translation: "What's the meaning of this?

source_sentence: 族姓子！
translation: sons of a great clan!

source_sentence: 汝於九品中何所志趣？
translation: What are your aspirations in the nine classes?

source_sentence: 為欲從過去初心耶？
translation: Is it because you want to start from a past intention?

source_sentence: 過去生心耶？
translation: What about the minds of past lives?

source_sentence: 過去眾生心耶？
translation: What about the minds of past sentient beings?

source_sentence: 為欲從未來初心耶？
translation: Is it because you want to follow the first thought in the future?

source_sentence: 未來一二心耶？
translation: Are there one or two minds in the future?

source_sentence: 未來無數劫心耶？
translation: What about the mind of the uncountable eons to come?

source_sentence: 為欲從現在初心耶？
translation: Why do you want to start from the present?

source_sentence: 現在一二心耶？
translation: Are there now one or two minds?

source_sentence: 現在無數心耶？」
translation: Are there countless minds now?"

source_sentence: 爾時，無畏菩薩前白佛言：「如我初發心求無上正真道，未能自知為求何道。
translation: At the time, the fearless bodhisattva went before the Buddha and said, "When I first set out to pursue the unsurpassed true path, I didn't know for sure what path I was pursuing.

source_sentence: 今聞如來說九品行，今始欲發弘誓大心，欲度過去初心未受塵垢者。」
translation: Now that I've heard the Tathāgata explain the nine grades of practice, I've just begun to want to give rise to the great intention of making a great vow to save those whose first thoughts were not yet stained by the dust of the past."

source_sentence: 佛言：「止！
translation: The Buddha said, "Stop!

source_sentence: 止！
translation: Stop!

source_sentence: 族姓子！
translation: sons of a great clan!

source_sentence: 汝今已墜墮初心，云何欲得於初心成無上等正覺乎？
translation: Now that you've fallen into the first mental state, how do you want to attain the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in the first mental state?

source_sentence: 此則不然。」
translation: This is not the case."

source_sentence: 無畏菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The fearless bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今於過去初心已墜落，願欲求過去度生心眾生普同等慧成無上等正覺。」
translation: Now, having fallen from the first state of mind in the past, I wish to seek to save sentient beings in the past and achieve unsurpassed perfect enlightenment with the same universal wisdom."

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝今已越此境墜墮下地，未能成辦拔濟眾生成無上等正覺。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Now that you've crossed this threshold and fallen to the lower ground, you're unable to accomplish the task of rescuing sentient beings and becoming unsurpassed and perfectly enlightened."

source_sentence: 爾時，無畏菩薩復白佛言：「云何？
translation: At that point, the fearless bodhisattva again said to the Buddha, "What is it?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於過去塵勞眾生，發弘誓心得成無上等正覺不乎？」
translation: Did you not make a great vow to become unsurpassed and perfectly enlightened while you were in the company of the world's dusty sentient beings?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「無也。
translation: The Buddha said, "No. Why is that?

source_sentence: 何以故？
